alert.note: Alert for Charlotte; Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:53PM EDT until July 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties, Charlotte and Halifax. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM EDT, Halifax 911 center reported road flooding in South Boston due to heavy rain from thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - South Boston is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Boston... Virgilina... Clover... Redoak... Scottsburg... Dryburg... Staunton River State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
